item.title: White House Says China Has Had Cuba Spy Base Since at Least 2019
item.description: A statement said Beijing’s efforts to expand its intelligence gathering are ongoing.

item.title: George Soros Hands Control to His 37-Year-Old Son: 'I'm More Political'
item.description: In his first interview as successor, Alex Soros says the family’s $25 billion philanthropic enterprise will boost its support for voting and abortion rights.

item.title: As Bakhmut Collapsed Around Them, This Family Clung On
item.description: Roman Dmytriev refused to evacuate his family, including two teenage daughters, even as Russia squeezed Ukrainian soldiers out.

item.title: Auto Parts Maker Resisting Recall Request Had Workplace-Safety Woes
item.description: ARC Automotive, the Chinese-owned maker of 67 million air-bag inflators that regulators want recalled, has faced safety violations and litigation over allegedly flawed parts.

item.title: How to Tell if You're the Office Jerk
item.description: It isn’t easy, because people don’t like to give negative feedback. But there are ways to find out—and fix things.

item.title: Trump, DeSantis Bring Tailored Messages to GOP Faithful
item.description: Campaign appearances Saturday offer a glimpse of how the two GOP presidential front-runners plan to portray Trump’s indictment in the 2024 campaign.

item.title: Unabomber Ted Kaczynski Dies in Federal Custody
item.description: The infamous recluse whose homemade explosives killed three people and injured more than 20 has died. He was 81.

item.description: New groups are forming to make people at the back of the pack feel more comfortable with the sport.

item.title: Why 16 Should Be the Minimum Age for Social Media
item.description: Doctors and policy makers say that 13 is too young for social media. Science suggests waiting would be better.

item.title: Ukrainian Troops Face Hard Slog in Offensive's First Days
item.description: Brigades with Western arms make small gains against Russia’s defensive lines in occupied regions.

item.title: Trump Faces 2024 Split Screen of Campaign, Criminal Trials
item.description: The former president’s indictment ensures his legal woes will be front and center through the GOP primaries and next year’s general election.

item.title: French Prosecutors Charge Syrian in Knife Attack on Children
item.description: Preliminary charges of attempted murder were filed against a 31-year-old Syrian man in this week’s attack in the French Alps.

item.title: Iga Swiatek Wins Third French Open in a Brilliant Bar Fight in Paris
item.description: Karolina Muchova rallies to give Iga Swiatek a battle, but the 22-year-old World No. 1 wins her second straight at Roland Garros, and third overall in Paris.

item.title: Nike Broke Up With Retailers. Now It's Trying to Win Them Back.
item.description: The sneaker maker’s strategy seeks to shed excess product as inflation pinches consumers’ budgets.

item.title: Crispin Odey Departs Hedge Fund He Founded After Sexual Abuse Allegations
item.description: His exit comes days after a report in which more than a dozen women accused him of wrongdoing, allegations he denied.
